Synopsis:
Set in Mississippi in the 1960s, "The Help" stars Emma Stone (star of the blockbuster, "Zombieland" [Zombieland] who plays Skeeter, a high society girl who returns from southern university willing to become a writer. But decides to interview black women who have spent their lives working in the service of the great southern families. This will plant a revolution in their circle of friends and in a small town in Mississippi. Viola Davis, nominated Academy Award Ã‚Â® ("Eat Pray Love" [Eat Pray Love]) stars as Aibileen, the maid and Skeeter's best friend, who is the first to open up to the scandal of her friends in the black community closed. spite that Skeeter is in danger of losing her old friends, she and Aibileen continue working on the project and achieve more women dare to tell their stories. because the funny thing is that they have much to say. As the story progresses unusual friendships are developed and a new sisterhood emerges. But first, the city dwellers also have to say some things to be irretrievably drawn into a world that is about to change forever.

Production notes:
"The Help" is based on one of the most talked about books in years and number one on the list of bestselling novels in the New York Times ("The Help" [Maids and Ladies]). It offers a provocative and candid perspective of what happens when three brave women, including those created unusual friendships, do blow up the unspoken code of rules and behavior of a southern U.S. city.
